Welcome to GEO419’s documentation!¶

download¶

scripts.download.download(url, path)¶

This function is used to download a file from a URL

Parameters:
  • url – string: Is the URL from which the download should be executed
  • path – string: Is the path where the download file and other folders are created and the result is saved
Returns:

Function has no return value

unzip¶

scripts.unzip.unzip(url, path)¶

This function is used to unzip the data

Parameters:
  • url – string: Is the URL from which the download should be executed
  • path – string: Is the path where the download file and other folders are created and the result is saved
Returns:

Function has no return value

processing_img¶

scripts.processing_img.calculation(band_1)¶

This function is used to convert linear values in dB values

Parameters:band_1 – numpy.ndarray: is the first channel from the tif
Returns:list: Returns a list with the new converted dB values
scripts.processing_img.open_raster_file(url, path)¶

this function is used to process the unziped data

Parameters:
  • url – string: Is the URL from which the download should be executed
  • path – string: Is the path where the download file and other folders are created and the result is saved
Returns:

Function has no return value

plot¶

scripts.plot.plot(path)¶

This function is used to plot the result

Parameters:path – string: Is the path where the download file and other folders are created and the result is saved
Returns:Function has no return value
